page.title: 02Wildlife
page.content: {This is a good area for nature-lovers. {Not only are there a number of {interesting animals but also the {tracks and paths over the hills {provide excellent vantage points to {view wildlife. { {As the walker steps out across the {downs, it is quite possible that a {buzzard may be soaring above him. Roe {deer are often seen in groups of about {four or five, and foxes can be seen in {the day and heard at night. Another {nocturnal animal, the badger, also {lives in this area. { {Groups of herons and sometimes an {elusive kingfisher can be seen along {the river banks.Mallards and moorhens {will also be found here. In the {rivers themselves trout are quite {numerous. }
